::: container ::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} ::: {.col .fixed-width} ::: {.image-container .text-center} ::: ::: ::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} The Big Fish card game aims to inform and engage everyone interested in fishing or marine conservation through fun play. The main goal of the game is to collect the maximum number of points from catching fish while also preserving a healthy ecosystem and fish size diversity for future catches. ::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} ::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center}

Suitable for ages 10+ ::: ::: ::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center}

Best for groups of 2-5 players ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ::: container ::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} ::: {.col .align-self-center .fixed-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center} ::: ::: ::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ### Catch Big fish are worth more points than small fish, so players are tempted to catch them. But the presence of big fish in the ecosystem allows players to draw new cards, spawn new fish, and grow more big fish! Players must find a balance between collecting points (by catching fish) and preserving enough fish for future fishing. ::: ::: ::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} ::: {.col .align-self-center .fixed-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center} ::: ::: ::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ### Adapt In addition to fishing, other natural and human-induced events occur throughout the game, such as fisheries research, poor water quality, citizen science, illegal fishing, ocean acidification and others. ::: ::: ::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} ::: {.col .align-self-center .fixed-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center} ::: ::: ::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ### Learn These events create unpredictability and new challenges, and inform players about human impacts on aquatic ecosystems. ::: ::: ::: ::: text-center ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Messages :::::: container ::::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} :::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} This game aims to introduce three main messages that we care about: ::: ol 1. Big fish are important. Big fish are important for population resilience, ecosystem balance and simply because they are beautiful. 2. Big fish are mostly all gone. Commercial and recreational fishing has removed most of the big fish from our oceans, lakes and rivers. 3. Big fish can return. Fish grow relatively fast. If we take the right measures, we can restore healthy ecosystems and their beauty within our lifetimes. ::: :::: :::: {.col .align-self-center .fixed-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center} ::: :::: ::::: :::::: ::: text-center ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # About the developers ::: callout-caution This game was developed by... ::: :::::: container ::::: {.row .d-flex .max-width} :::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center} [](pages/AboutDevs.qmd#sec-contact-us)

[Our supporters and collaborators](pages/AboutDevs.qmd#sec-support){style="text-decoration:none"} ::: :::: :::: {.col .align-self-center .flex-width .buffer-10} ::: {.image-container .text-center} [](pages/AboutDevs.qmd#sec-contact-us)

[Media enquiries](pages/AboutDevs.qmd#sec-contact-us){style="text-decoration:none"} ::: :::: ::::: ::::::
